channel.title: Posts on Yaxin Li
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Yaxin Li

item.title: The Journey to FinTech
item.description: Welcome to my blog! I’m thrilled to kick things off by sharing a bit about my journey into the world of data-driven decision-making within FinTech. For as long as I can remember, I’ve been fascinated by numbers and patterns, leading me first into mathematics and finance, and then into the world of data engineering. Now, I have the privilege of applying these skills to the dynamic challenges in credit risk and strategy.

item.title: Journey into Data Engineering
item.description:
1. Introduction: From Intern to Data Engineer

My journey as a Data Engineer began with curiosity — how do banks turn millions of data points into insights that drive lending or risk strategy? Over time, I found myself designing ETL pipelines, automating workflows, and even building machine learning pipelines to predict loan delinquency.

Before becoming a full-time Data Engineer, I started as a DE intern for 3 months. That experience helped me understand the fundamentals of data pipelines, governance, and business reporting. Later, I joined a bank where I spent 1.5 years as a Data Engineer, supporting business intelligence, automation, and analytics for multiple departments.

item.title: Think Ahead with ACCA
item.description:
My ACCA journey began with one idea that resonated deeply with me: “Think Ahead.” I wanted a deep understanding of business and a framework to make strategic, forward-looking decisions.

Through completing all foundational modules and three professional-level modules, I gained structured training across areas that directly strengthen my work in financial analytics, business strategy, and data-driven decision-making. Beyond the technical knowledge, the ACCA “Think Ahead” mindset profoundly shaped how I approach challenges — encouraging me to anticipate risks, identify opportunities, and act proactively.

item.title: Journey into Gen AI & Kaggle
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Comprehensive Generative AI Framework: Gained a foundational understanding of Generative AI concepts, covering LLM evolution, embeddings, AI agents, domain-specific LLMs, and MLOps practices.
  • Practical Skills: Hands-on experience with the Gemini API, embedding usage, grounding techniques, function calling in LLMs, fine-tuning custom models, and applying MLOps with Vertex AI.
  • Domain Specialization: Learned to fine-tune models like Gemini for domain-specific tasks, such as analyzing payment behavior, predicting default probabilities, and creating customized credit scoring models using proprietary FinTech data.
  • Real-World Applications: Learned to bridge AI systems with external tools (e.g., SQL, Google Search) and deploy sophisticated AI agents for practical use cases.

Objective

To empower participants with a deep understanding and practical skills to design, deploy, and manage generative AI solutions, leveraging state-of-the-art tools and techniques to solve real-world challenges efficiently.
